item.title: With ‘Tremendous’ Deals at Stake, Trump Is Bringing Russia in From the Cold
item.description: Since President Trump took office more than a year ago, the Kremlin has dangled possible investments in front of the famously transactional leader. The message is starting to resonate with investors.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.media:description: President Trump with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia during a meeting in Alaska last year.

item.title: As Trump Weighs Iran Strikes, He Declines to Make Clear Case for Why
item.description: Rarely in modern times has the United States prepared to conduct a major act of war with so little explanation or public debate.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger
item.category: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump speaking at the inaugural Board of Peace meeting in Washington on Thursday.

item.title: Refugees Without Green Cards Could Be Arrested Under New Trump Policy
item.description: The change is part of the administration’s broad effort to target refugees and tighten pathways for immigrants to legally enter or remain in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Immigration agents stopping drivers in Minneapolis last month.

item.title: MAHA Moms Turn Against Trump: ‘Women Feel Like They Were Lied To’
item.description: President Trump’s executive order aimed at spurring production of a pesticide has infuriated leaders of Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s MAHA movement.
item.dc:creator: Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Hiroko Tabuchi
item.media:credit: Al Drago for The New York Times
item.media:description: Supporters of Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. onstage with him at a news conference last year.

item.title: British Police Arrest Former Prince Andrew Amid Scrutiny Over Epstein Ties
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, a longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein, is being investigated on suspicion of misconduct in public office.
item.dc:creator: Megan Specia, Michael D. Shear and Michael Levenson
item.category: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
item.media:description: Police officers at an entrance to Wood Farm on the royal family’s Sandringham Estate on Thursday, where Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was living.

item.title: Former Prince Andrew’s Arrest Casts Shadow Over UK Monarchy
item.description: The arrest of the former prince could shake public confidence in the monarchy.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Castle
item.category: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
item.media:description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor on King Charles III’s coronation day in 2023.

item.title: A British police force that serves as royal protectors arrested a former prince.
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden
item.media:description: Windsor Castle on Thursday. Day to day, officers from the Thames Valley Police provide armed teams and mounted officers to guard the castle.

item.title: Labor Secretary’s Husband Barred From Department Premises After Reports of Sexual Assaults
item.description: At least two female staff members said Dr. Shawn DeRemer had touched them inappropriately at the agency in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Evan Gorelick and Rebecca Davis O’Brien
item.media:description: Allegations against Dr. Shawn DeRemer, the husband of Labor Secretary Lori Chavez-DeRemer, were raised as part of an investigation by the Labor Department’s inspector general.

item.title: Two Sisters Died in Tahoe Area Avalanche During Trek With Friends
item.description: Families and friends of the women, many from the Bay Area, confirmed their identities. The women went on regular trips to the Tahoe region and were experienced skiers, the families said.
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Tavernise, Heather Knight and Soumya Karlamangla
item.media:credit: Max Whittaker for The New York Times
item.media:description: The trail to Castle Peak in the Lake Tahoe region on Wednesday.

item.title: What We Know About the Victims of the Tahoe Area Avalanche
item.description: Many of the people on the fatal trek were women — mothers, sisters and wives — with ties to Marin County, Calif.
item.dc:creator: Heather Knight, Sabrina Tavernise and Soumya Karlamangla
item.media:credit: Max Whittaker for The New York Times
item.media:description: The trail to Castle Peak near Donner Pass. Eight backcountry skiers died in an avalanche in the Castle Peak area at Donner Pass.

item.title: Ukrainian Women Tell Their Stories of Sexual Violence by Russian Soldiers
item.description: Hundreds of Ukrainian women and girls have reported sexual violence by Russian troops during the four-year war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Lynsey Addario and Sara Cincurova
item.media:description: Darya with her mother near Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, in June. Darya said a drunken Russian soldier had forced his hands into her underwear and shouted “I want a young body!”

item.title: Eric Dane, McSteamy on ‘Grey’s Anatomy,’ Dies at 53 After Battling ALS
item.description: His breakout role came in 2006 as the handsome Dr. Mark Sloan, nicknamed McSteamy, the head of plastic surgery at a Seattle hospital. He died 10 months after announcing his A.L.S. diagnosis.
item.dc:creator: Johnny Diaz
item.media:description: Eric Dane revealed in April 2025 that he had A.L.S.

item.title: Trump Says He Will Release Files on Aliens and U.F.O.s
item.description: President Trump had lashed out at former President Barack Obama earlier Thursday for telling a podcaster that aliens were real.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump said that he has directed his administration to begin releasing files related to aliens.

item.title: Venezuela Passes Amnesty Bill Denounced by Some as ‘Unjust’
item.description: The bill may bring the release of hundreds of political prisoners. But many critics say the legislation, passed after major pressure from the Trump administration, raises concerns.
item.dc:creator: Max Bearak, Annie Correal, Patricia Sulbarán, Isayen Herrera and Genevieve Glatsky
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.media:description: Families gathered last month for a vigil outside El Rodeo I, a prison east of Caracas, Venezuela.

item.title: A Press Freedom Case in Peril, From a Lawyer Who Helped Write It
item.description: Alan Dershowitz was present at the creation of New York Times v. Sullivan. Now he is asking the Supreme Court to revise or destroy it.
item.dc:creator: Adam Liptak
item.category: New York Times v Sullivan (Supreme Court Decision)
item.media:description: Alan Dershowitz during the impeachment trial of President Trump in January 2020.

item.title: How Did Draco Malfoy Get Mixed Up With Lunar New Year?
item.description: It all comes down to a love of wordplay.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca L. Davis
item.media:description: A Lunar New Year display showing a young Tom Felton as Draco Malfoy in Shangqiu, China, this month.

item.title: Their Transgender Child’s Health Care Had Ended. What Now?
item.description: In many ways, the parents whose adolescents had been receiving treatment at NYU Langone Health had been expecting this call. Still, they were stunned.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Goldstein
item.category: New York University Langone Medical Center
item.media:credit: Gabby Jones for The New York Times
item.media:description: For years, NYU Langone and some other major New York hospitals had built up significant transgender youth health programs.

item.title: Some Reese’s Treats Drop the Milk Chocolate. Mr. Reese Disapproves.
item.description: With cocoa prices high, Hershey’s has changed some of its candy recipes. The grandson of the man who invented of the original Peanut Butter Cup said he was “embarrassed.”
item.dc:creator: Claire Brown

item.title: A Lonely Baby Monkey Wins Hearts, and Even a Few Friends
item.description: Legions of fans from around the world have been cheering on Punch, a 7-month-old macaque who had been struggling to socialize at a zoo outside Tokyo.
item.dc:creator: Remy Tumin
item.media:credit: Ko Sasaki for The New York Times
item.media:description: Punch with his plush companion at Ichikawa City Zoo.

item.title: This Is How an Autocrat Goes to War
item.description: All that matters to Trump is whether he thinks attacking Iran is in his interests.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Goldberg
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times

item.title: Welcome to the Indian Century
item.description: India is winning the standoff between America and China.
item.dc:creator: Ross Douthat and Victoria Chamberlin

item.title: Police Investigate ICE Arrest of a Man Who Suffered Severe Head Injuries
item.description: The police in St. Paul, Minn., are investigating an arrest last month during the immigration crackdown. The man has said he was beaten by agents. ICE asserted that he ran into a wall.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
item.media:description: Alberto Castañeda Mondragón told The Associated Press that he was in a friend’s car at a shopping center in St. Paul, Minn., when immigration agents pulled him from the car.

item.title: Investigators Blame NASA and Boeing for Starliner Failures
item.description: Technical and oversight problems left two astronauts aboard the International Space Station for months longer than had been expected.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Chang
item.media:description: The Boeing Starliner spacecraft that carried the astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams to the International Space Station, seen on July 3, 2024.

item.title: Blue Owl Capital Sets Off New Fears About the Private Credit Industry
item.description: The lender’s announcement that investors will no longer be able to ask for a set amount of money back from its funds prompted worries about the private credit industry.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Farrell
item.media:description: Blue Owl Capital, the large private lender, has amassed nearly $300 billion in investor money.

item.title: Powerful Winds and Wildfires Have the Southern Plains on Edge
item.description: A combustible mix of weather ingredients has sparked worries about new fires in Oklahoma and Texas.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz and Amy Graff
